result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke J. Shilts

records.addlTxt:
3:00 pm cases 21CF1329, 21CM957, 22CF405, 22CF786 called. Defendant Luke J. Shilts in court, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Luke J. Shilts.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense recites the joint agreement. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions to support repeater enhancers. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

In 22CF786: Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 1, 22, 23 and 25 as charged in the Information. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Defense makes a statement before sentencing. Court addresses the defendant before sentencing. 

As to Counts 23 and 25: Defendant is to pay court costs including DNA sample and one bench warrant fee. 

As to Count 1: Court imposes but Stays pending successful completion of Probation: 5 years Initial Confinement and 5 years Extended Supervision. 
Defendant is places defendant on Probation for 5 years with Conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide a DNA sample. 
Testify honestly in all court proceedings. Participate in and successfully complete treatment court. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
No contact with Jesse Erickson or Marty Monhead. 
No contact with N.B. 
Pay restitution in an amount to be determined within 60 days. 
Pay court costs including DNA sample. 
120 days in Jail all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
If revoked, defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP programming. 

As to count 22: Sentence is withheld. Defendant is placed on Probation for 30 months with the same conditions as count 1 except no jail time. 
Defendant has 101 days credit if revoked from Probation.
Plea hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:29 AM Cases called: 21CF1329, 21CM957, 22CF405 & 22CF786. Defendant Luke J. Shilts in court, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Luke J. Shilts. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 21CF1329, 22CF405 & 22CF405 and Court accepts waiver. 

Cases are referred to Br. 1 for a Plea Hearing as the parties have an agreement.

records.addlTxt:
(1:41 PM cases 21CM957, 21CF1329, 22CF405, 22CF786 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Luke J. Shilts in court, in custody. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Luke J. Shilts.
Attorney Patek moves to withdraw from the defendant's cases due to a conflict.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Attorney Patek advises will take a couple weeks to appoint new counsel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with H.S., H.S.'s residence, co-defendant (D.S., J.E.), M.M., J.G., L.G., any Fleet Farm locations, any Rogan's locations, G.G.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 21CM957, 21CF1329, 22CF405, 22CF786)

(Cases 21CM957, 21CF1329, 22CF405, 22CF786 are called at 11:24 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Luke Shilts appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants in 21CM957, 21CF1329, 22CF405 are executed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint in 22CF786 and updates the Defendant's phone number. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. State requests $25,000 cash bond to cover all 4 cases. Defense requests $1,000 cash bond. Court orders $20,000 cash bond with various conditions. 
Preliminary Hearing in  21CF1329, 22CF405, 22CF786 and Hearing in 21CM957: 07/19/2022 at 1:30 PM.

Case called at 10:07 AM: 21CF1329, 21CM957, 22CF405.
Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luke J. Shilts not in court.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Luke J. Shilts. 
Attorney Patek has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. 
Court notes prior non-appearance. State requests warrant. Warrants ordered.
